title: Watering Tips
tips: Water indoor plants only when the top inch of soil feels dry.
Avoid overwatering as it can lead to root rot.
Use room-temperature water to prevent plant shock.
Ensure pots have proper drainage holes.
Reduce watering frequency during winter months.
Succulent plants require less frequent watering.
Empty excess water from saucers after watering.
Water early in the morning for best absorption.
Different plants have different watering needs.
Always check soil moisture before watering.

title: Sunlight Tips
tips: Most indoor plants thrive in bright indirect sunlight.
Avoid placing plants in direct harsh afternoon sun.
Rotate plants weekly for even growth.
Low-light plants can survive in shaded rooms.
South-facing windows provide the most light.
Use sheer curtains to filter strong sunlight.
Observe leaf color changes to adjust light levels.
Artificial grow lights can supplement natural light.
Clean leaves regularly to improve light absorption.
Seasonal sunlight changes may affect plant health.

title: Fertilizing Tips
tips: Fertilize plants during their active growing season.
Avoid fertilizing newly repotted plants immediately.
Use balanced liquid fertilizer for indoor plants.
Over-fertilizing can burn plant roots.
Dilute fertilizer to half strength for safety.
Reduce fertilizing during winter dormancy.
Organic fertilizers improve long-term soil health.
Follow fertilizer instructions carefully.
Yellow leaves may indicate nutrient deficiency.
Flush soil occasionally to remove salt buildup.
